title: Passages from the English Note-books of Nathaniel Hawthorne. [Edited by S. H., i.e. Sophia Hawthorne.]
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: July 9th (Our wedding-day.) — We were invited yesterday evening to Mrs. S. C. Hall's, where Jenny Lind was to sing; so we left Blackheath at about eight o'clock in a brougham, and reached Ashley Place, as the dusk was gathering, after nine. The Halls reside in a handsome suite of apartments, arranged on the new system of flats, each story constituting a separate tenement, and the various families

title: Passages from the English Note-books of Nathaniel Hawthorne. [Edited by S. H., i.e. Sophia Hawthorne.]
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: We then drove to Ashley Place, to call on Mrs. S. C. Hall, whom we found at home. In fact, Wednesday is her reception-day; although, as now everybody is out of town, we were the only callers.
